<<<api>>>: Activity.setContentView
<<<code>>>: public class MyClass extends Activity implements View.OnClickListener {
    CheckBox cb1;
    CheckBox cb2;

    @Override
    public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);

        cb1 = (CheckBox) findViewById(R.id.cb1);
        cb2 = (CheckBox) findViewById(R.id.cb2);
    }

    public void checkboth(View view) {
        cb1.setChecked(true);
        cb2.setChecked(true);
    }

    @Override
    public void onClick(View v) {
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The findViewById method should be called after the setContentView method. The setContentView method is usually called in the onCreate method of the Activity. This is because the setContentView method inflates the layout and creates the view hierarchy. Only after this, the findViewById method can find the view in the hierarchy. If you try to call findViewById before setContentView, it will return null because the view hierarchy has not been created yet. Therefore, you should initialize your CheckBox variables in the onCreate method after calling setContentView.
